name: sfchronicle
text: The most popular campsites in the Bay Area, the trail camps at Point Reyes National Seashore, will re-open Thursday with an array of new rules. @StienstraTom has some advice for your next hike: https://t.co/H4fof2nRy0

name: sfchronicle
text: We've unearthed photos of Ringo Starr's 1964 stop at San Francisco International Airport at the height of Beatlemania: https://t.co/ZqBhd6vt4d

text: #SFHomelessProject: Want to help local nonprofits that combat homelessness? You can search by region, need and cause in our directory: https://t.co/drOjCIgPiw

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: California records 146 COVID-19 deaths, breaking the state's record for most deaths in a day, with several counties yet to report. The previous high of 122 deaths was recorded on May 19. https://t.co/CGfggNHC8x

name: sfchronicle
text:
Patterns of discrimination in Bay Area restaurant industry: https://t.co/uDAfKQxcry

- Widest wage gap of any metro area between white workers and people of color in upscale establishments

- POC half as likely to be hired for fine dining front-of-house job as white person

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Texas resumed executions of inmates after a five-month delay due to the coronavirus pandemic. Inmate Billy Joe Wardlow was put to death by lethal injection for a 1993 fatal shooting. https://t.co/V2lB8a9Uka

name: sfchronicle
text: Long-term use of some common heartburn drugs may be tied to a higher risk for COVID-19, according to a new study led by Dr. Brennan Spiegel of Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. https://t.co/BXomKH3bYD

name: sfchronicle
text: One more health care worker died from COVID-19 and 339 others tested positive for the coronavirus. There are now 16,629 cases and 95 deaths among California's health care workforce. https://t.co/AuleqfeAhU

name: sfchronicle
text: Fencing and 10 other so-called minor sports will become extinct after Stanford‚Äôs 2020-21 academic year, the university announced Wednesday. It was either drop those 11 or drop football. @ScottOstler is pretty sure there wasn‚Äôt a coin flip. https://t.co/Plx8zskKq5

name: sfchronicle
text:

text: 1.3 million Americans filed for unemployment benefits last week, showing that the pandemic‚Äôs economic toll continues to be unrelenting, with start-stop reopenings jeopardizing any recovery. https://t.co/F7f3VsdOkB

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: The Supreme Court has upheld a prosecutor‚Äôs demand for President Trump‚Äôs tax returns as part of a criminal investigation that includes hush-money payments to women who claim they had affairs with Trump. https://t.co/h6g0Jac4I1

name: sfchronicle
text: A 35-year-old man who pulled into an Antioch driveway late Wednesday was killed when at least one suspect opened fire into the vehicle, bringing the city‚Äôs death toll to two in one day after a morning stabbing. https://t.co/epyleSyCg1

name: sfchronicle
text: President Trump must release his income tax returns and financial records to New York prosecutors investigating hush money payments, the Supreme Court ruled Thursday, but he is not required to release them to Congress. https://t.co/UpxbcfTkF7

name: sfchronicle
text: The Coastside Fishing Club released 720,000 salmon smolts from fish pens at Pillar Point Harbor, bringing the number to 4.7 million in the past nine years ‚Äî and salmon are again king of the coast on fishing boats. https://t.co/6eBvnmjPUo

name: sfchronicle
text:
In Half Moon Bay, a volunteer fishing group released 720,000 salmon smolts from pens last week at Pillar Point Harbor, bringing the number released to 4.7 million in the past nine years. 

@stienstratom has more: https://t.co/Hblj8HSB6z

name: sfchronicle
text: Legal experts and officials in SF, including the public defender and district attorney‚Äôs offices, sent a joint letter to the Superior Court urging it to resume a zero-bail policy as coronavirus cases have started increasing in the county jail. https://t.co/k83eMFfBrh

name: sfchronicle
text: The transformation of SF‚Äôs historic Pier 70 shipyard includes raising Building 12 by 10 feet. That‚Äôs a lot, considering it weighs 4.5 million pounds. https://t.co/KiXtlDZytd

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @pfimrite: In every state and all countries men get sicker and die more often from #COVID19 than women. Infectious disease specialists believe sex hormones help the virus infiltrate human cells https://t.co/0eAAo1xsST

name: sfchronicle
text: History shows that when some white people feel threatened by social justice movements, they lash out. The backlash to the Black Lives Matter movement hasn't been much different, writes @otisrtaylorjr. https://t.co/T60jwlqtGI

name: sfchronicle
text:
EXCLUSIVE: @TheatreFirst's white leader Jon Tracy is stepping aside to create a pipeline for rising leaders of color. 

He calls the move more a "repositioning" than a "demotion." https://t.co/f4Pl64HR8q
